meanings.definition: To cast a spell over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The magician used his wand to bewitch the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: The witch's potion was said to bewitch anyone who drank it.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they pretended to bewitch each other with imaginary spells.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the music seemed to bewitch the listeners, holding them in a trance.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious book seemed to bewitch all who read its pages, drawing them into its world.

meanings.sent1: The fairy used her magic wand to bewitch the forest with twinkling lights.
meanings.sent2: The storyteller's tales never failed to bewitch the children gathered around.
meanings.sent3: The old watch seemed to bewitch its owner, always keeping perfect time.
meanings.sent4: The painting had a mesmerizing quality that seemed to bewitch all who gazed upon it.
meanings.sent5: The garden was bewitched by the blooming flowers, creating a magical atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The dancer's graceful movements seemed to bewitch the entire audience.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious stranger had a charm that could bewitch even the most skeptical person.
meanings.sent3: The sparkling gemstone seemed to bewitch all who laid eyes on it, drawing them closer.
meanings.sent4: The actor's performance was so captivating that it could bewitch the viewers for hours.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact had a mystical aura that seemed to bewitch all who saw it.
